result.execSummary:
The defendant Alicia D McClellan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Physical Abuse Of A Child (Reckless Causation Of Bodily Harm), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Report for probation by 5 p.m. on 10/21/2022.
Probation review hearing January 13, 2023 at 1:30 p.m.

miscConds.notes:
Complete a parenting class.
Complete an anger management class.
Mental health assessment. Comply with recommended treatment.
Comply with any recommended treatment of the agent.

No use or possession of firearms.
No contact with victim only pursuant to CHIPS case.
Full time work, school or a combination.

Provide a DNA sample. Court will allow defendant to give DNA sample at local jail.
Pay the domestic abuse assessment fee.
Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges including DNA and DV during period of probation. If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Court waives all nonmandatory costs, fees and surcharges.

timeConds.notes: STAYED: to be used at the discretion of the agent.

charges.descr: Physical Abuse Of A Child (Reckless Causation Of Bodily Harm)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alicia D McClellan

records.addlTxt: Per correspondence with defense counsel; Court will remove deadline for the DNA sample and will allow defendant to submit sample after probation is set up.

Defendant Alicia D McClellan appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Alicia D McClellan.  Attorney Katherine Seelow appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant ordered to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, credit of 1 day time served, Huber Privileges for work. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 24 MONTHS with the following conditions:

- Report for probation by 5pm on 10/21/2022.
- Court stayed 90 days condition time; STAYED to be used at the discretion of the agent.
- Complete a parenting class.
- Complete an anger management class.
- Mental health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Comply with any recommended treatment of the agent.
- No use of possession of firearms.
- Full time work, school or a combination.
- No with victim only pursuant to CHIPS case.
- Provide a DNA sample.  Court will allow defendant to give DNA sample at local jail.
- Pay the Domestic Abuse Assessment fee.

- Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA and DV) during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Defendant advised of appeal rights.

Defendant Alicia D McClellan appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Alicia D McClellan.  Attorney Katherine Seelow appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his/her client.   Amended Information charges Defendant as follows  

AS TO COUNT 1: PHYSICAL ABUSE OF A CHILD (RECKLESS CAUSATION OF BODILY HARM), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s)  948.03(3)(b), 939.50(3)(i) Wis. Stats, a Class I Felony.
Received and Filed. Certificates and Documentation
Received and Filed. and Addendum
Received and Filed. Jury Instructions - Child Abuse
Received and Filed. Offer Letter
Received and Filed. Ineligible Voting Notice
Received and Filed. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Alicia D McClellan appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Alicia D McClellan.  Attorney Katherine Seelow in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Alicia D McClellan in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
signed, Stipulation and Order Regarding Use of Videotaped Statements

Defendant Alicia D McClellan in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appear via zoom.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM.  In colloquy with parties and defendant, the Court found right to in-person/ in court hearing has been waived. Court proceeded with Preliminary hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 35, Judge Rosa. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 35.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
filed.

Defendant Alicia D McClellan in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for preliminary hearing. Defense counsel requests an adjournment. Court grants request. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (5/28/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with M.D.C. (dob 6/3/2005). 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Alicia D McClellan in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES  QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 35.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Alicia D McClellan
Current: 1434 W Burleigh Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 05-26-2022)
Prior: 4532 North 21st Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/26/2022@2:30pm
